Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: voyagemom
Reviews.Content: This is the third Starwood property we have stayed at in Montreal. Found it to be the most convenient if you want to use your car. The only thing lacking is a pool. The valet service was only $27 for the day with unlimited use and a smile. Plus it was very quick to get & leave your car. Coming in from the main highway, when you pass the hotel take the first right onto St Mathieu and leave the car there while you unload. It is also very easy to get your bearings from Sherbrooke. I was able to find everything from here and it is literally two street turns from the highway. If you are visiting either Concordia University or McGill the location is ideal. And if you are a "foodie" from the states - it couldn't be more simple to pass the Atwater Market on your way home from here to stock up on Quebecois specialties. We were upgraded to a deluxe double which was very large and full of light. While the decor was a bit dated - we found it charming & comfortable. We very much like the small feel of the hotel and enjoyed the warm welcome from all the staff. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: TraderJoe911
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights at the Le Meridien in Montreal. I got a room in the 3rd floor at the end of the floor far away from the elevators, so it was all nice and quiet. The room itself and the bathroom were rather small, but clean and in good shape. The bed was extremely comfortable, even though the mattresses may be a little hard for some people. Only problem was the loud AC, but I just had the personnel switch the thing off and I had no problem after that. The Hotel is a 5 Minute walk from the Metro (Guy-Concordia) and there are dozens of small restaurants in the neighborhood from Greek to Chinese. Center City is also a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “European style in Sherbrooke”
Reviews.Author: Eli G
Reviews.Content: Spent there 3 nights. The hotel is not very modern and spacious as some of the other options on Sherbrooke, however, I can't remember such a service in a north American hotel lately. The lobby is almost not existent, however some functions (Such as computer services) are on the second floor Printing and internet are free The staff knows you by name, they will reserve for you a place in the restaurant you want and will not push for their's like in many other places. Rooms are kind of old but they are maintained well I got a great rate via priceline so for me, it was an exceptional deal

Reviews.Title: “Worst SPG experience in 15 years”
Reviews.Author: Pascal02467
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the property for a 3 nights this past long week-end for a family stay. I have been frequenting Starwood properties for 15+ years, many of those as a platinum or gold level member. This was by far my worst Starwood experience ever and one of my bottom decile in any North American hotel. Issues included: - Toilet bowl not being cleaned despite visible dirt - Towels not being replaced when dirty and left on the floor (as the green program states) - Wet towels being left in random locations in the room after housekeeping had done the room - Coffee service being randomly replenished - Defective fawcet in bathroom - Completely botched breakfast order for 3 out 4 orders After (very politely and calmly) bringing this up with both the front desk, manager AND a SPG customer service in a couple of occasions the net/net was one night's free parking out of 3 and 5K starwood points (which don't even amount to one night in an equivalent Category 3 property). The only thing that was less acceptable than the quality of the experience at the Meridien Versailles is the manner in which they AND SPG handled the incident after the fact. Deeply disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “quiet gem, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: rosey1963Toronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October while in Montreal for the McGill and Concordia open house days and loved the place! the staff are very attentive and helpful, the hotel is quiet and lovely and well appointed, with the rooms having fridges and microwaves plus a coffee maker. we were walking distance to everything of interest and our room key gave access to several very interesting museums within the area. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small property, top-notch staff, reliable service.”
Reviews.Author: newyorkbo
Reviews.Content: This is the first time which I have stayed at this property in Montreal. It is a bit further west than the properties i normally choose. I almost always stay at Starwood properties and have stayed often at Le Centre Sheraton and the Westin. Le Meridien is very close to the Guy-Concordia subway stop which is very convenient, especially in the winter. It is only a couple of blocks away from la rue Ste Catherine which is full of shops. There are two economical ways to get to this property and both start with the 747 bus service. This service costs $8. The ticket is valid for 24 hours for all of the buses and metros within the city. I was staying for three days so I bought the three day pass for $16. !) The first way to get to the hotel is to get off of the 747 at the first stop which is the Lionel Grioult subway station. Here you can take the green line two stops to the Guy-Concordia subway stop. If you exit the subway stop on St Matthieu you need only walk up the street a short way to Sherbrooke and turn left to find the hotel. 2) The second way to get to the hotel is to take the same bus to the second stop which is rue Guy. From here you walk uphill past several side streets and three major streets (and past the Guy-Concordia subway stop) to Sherbrooke where, on the left, you will find the hotel. This might be a nice walk in the Spring, Summer and Fall but is not advised in the middle of winter. it's survivable but not fun when schlepping a suitcase. Of the three Starwood properties in which I have stayed in Montreal I would recommend both le Meridien Versailles and the Westin. - Le Centre Sheraton is huge, you will often need to wait in line to speak with their rather brusque staff-members, the Platinum lounge is very large but the staff in the lounge are unwelcoming. The rooms are a nice size but the ceiling is poured concrete - a very ugly industrial look from the 70s which made me feel cold and uncomfortable. - The Westin is also large and seems to host many conventions. The great advantage to this hotel is that it is located immediately next to the subway (Place d'Armes) and also immediately next to Old Montreal with its myriad of restaurants. The rooms are all standard Westin rooms, very comfortable and modern. You will also need to stand in line to speak with anyone at the front desk or concierge. I remember asking the concierge this summer for information about the film festival which was taking place that week and she didn't know what I was talking about. She pulled up the website and started reading to me. I was expecting to receive some type of handy pocket-sized guide. - Le Meridien Versailles is much smaller with almost no lobby and the rooms are rather out-of-date. The bathroom is very 70s chic but everything worked fine. The staff are the saving feature of this hotel. They were all very kind and accessible. Overall, Le Meridien Versailles is fine if you are spending three or four days in the city for business. It is often more affordable than the Westin and the subway is only a short distance away. if I were visiting for touristic reasons and could get a good rate at the Westin I would prefer its location, next to Le Vieux Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Harry F
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at this hotel when I teach in Montreal. My flight from Toronto to Montreal on January 13 arrived at midnight instead of 8.40pm. My baggage unfortunately was not sent so I was stuck with no luggage. Checked into hotel at 1.00am. Derek on the front desk was extremely helpful. He had security find me some toiletries and delivered to my room. I was extremely impressed with the help I received. Thank you very much Derek. Harry F

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Lanaj47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in November and felt that we had probably chosen the wrong hotel for us which makes it a little difficult to properly review it. As tourists we found the location was not particularly suitable. Although one of the important galleries was quite nearby most of the places we wanted to see were quite a distance from the hotel and as we prefer to explore on foot it made for a lot more walking than we preferred. We also found it difficult to find decent reasonably priced food near the hotelt. Plenty of cheap student food of poor quality and very expensive restaurants, but nothing in the middle. We were particularly disappointed in the lack of French bistro style eating opportunities in the area. Unfortanately the lack of a choice of dining opportunities at the hotel was a problem also as there wasn't a suitable place to go for a coffee or a light snack. This was particularly a problem when we came in at night and didn't want to go directly to the room. The room was ordinary even though it was an upgrade. The bathroom fittings were a little dodgy but worked. It was very dark and the fact that it overlooked a lane didn't help. There was a bit of a privacy problem in that the room looked straight across the lane into private dwellings. . The staff were very good - always polite and helpful. The desk staff quickly amended an incorrect entry on our account when it was pointed out. I would not recommend the hotel to tourists although it is a good value for money if you are travelling on a budget. But, as someone who has travelled extensively on business I would recommend it as an excellent option. Very good value for money and well located for business I would imagine. For many business people would find just the thing.

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of updating”
Reviews.Author: lmntoronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip about a week ago and the hotel is in desparate need of a makeover. The rooms were dated and nothing special. After having issues with noise coming from the heaters, we were moved to another room on the executive level which was probably what I would have expected the rest of the rooms to look like. The main difference was the bedding. If you are a light sleeper, I would suggest staying elsewhere - the heat goes off an on to maintain temperature and when it goes on, it's loud.

Reviews.Title: “Always my favorite”
Reviews.Author: eweinz22
Reviews.Content: great hotel in Montreal, off the main drag so it's somewhat quiet. I always get my platinum upgrade here and the staff couldn't be nicer. Not a ton of restaurants in walking distance but the spot downstairs is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller and pleasant hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TLCanada
Reviews.Content: The Meridien is a pleasant boutique style hotel centrally located on downtown Montreal. The room was clean and spacious, although slightly dated. The bed was not the usual Westin bed that I get with the Starwood chain but comfortable enough. It's an older hotel that has been updated but very cean. Small lobby and one restaurant within. Because this hotel is centrally located (10 min walk to St. Catharines for excellent shopping) and very close to Musee DES Beaux Arts, there are plenty of food options to choose from. Hotel resto is overpriced for breakfast. Valet parking was good but somewhat confusing as you pull up on St Mathieu and then go into lobby to let them know. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age”
Reviews.Author: DBM24
Reviews.Content: This was the third SPG hotel I stayed at in the previous third weeks. The Le Meridien Versailles was not up to the same standards as the Westin or Sheraton, and I think this is because of the age of the hotel. I stayed in a regular king-size room on the third floor. As others have noted the hallways are very narrow, and as such you do hear quite a bit of noise in your room at all hours. The bed was comfortable....not quite Westin standards, but comfortable. My room had a particularly noisy heater. When it came on, it banged, and rattled while it was on, and then when it shut off, it gave a large hisss. I lived with it for the first night, and was so tired the next day I just collapsed into bed and forgot to request a change or room. I really couldn't be bothered to get changed again, re-pack, and change rooms, so I endured the hissing/banging for the rest of the night. When I checked out in the morning, the front-desk staff asked if I had any issues. I usually just say no, but remembered to mention the heater. They were quick to respond to say they would have a technician look at it. At the same time they admitted their heaters are very noisy, and replacing them is quite expensive. They claimed they have started to do so, but started with the top floors first (I think there are 14 floors). I was on the 3rd floor. The area was convenient for my business. The internet worked reasonably well, and as mentioned the bed was comfortable. I also found the sound-scape in the elevators quite interesting. I wasn't aware the hotel room keys would let you into the art museums until I started writing this post, and then read previous reviews. As such, I would say the front desk could have done a better job here. The art galleries are about a 10-15 minute walk away, so this would have a been a big plus...even for business travellers. I'd be willing to give this place another shot....but only one more shot to impress me.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerCa_11
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be generally very run down, the room was "clean" but there were stains in the carpet and torn wallpaper. Bathrooms are tiny and the fixtures seem old. Was staying on business and had to get out early to a meeting -- there is no food available at the hotel before 7am so not very convenient if you have to get out to an early meeting. Also, no cabs waiting outside so had to wait 10 minutes for the a cab to come. Not a great location, very expensive restaraunt/bar for evening meal for average food. The elevators are very small and there are no real hallways when you get out of the elevator so lots of noise in the evenings of people coming and going when you're trying to sleep. Staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's best.”
Reviews.Author: Coventrylass
Reviews.Content: Hotel was adequate for a 3 night stay. The room was large with comfortable seating area. The bed was VERY comfortable & clean, bathroon was fine. The room could do with a refurb. & possibly the rest of the hotel too. On the first morning, we,decided along with several members of the group we were in to stay in the hotel for breakfast which we all found to be very poor for the price with tiny portions of 'not very much'. We ate out for the rest of the stay. Other than that, the staff were very polite & welcoming. I agree with a previous 'reviewer' that the area in which the Meridien is situated is a bit run-down. Would I stay there again? Maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Older property but the staff shine”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there twice over 2 weeks. I had last visited the Meridien about 5 years ago. Location The Meridien is located in the "Concordia University" vicinity so the area is a bit run-down. Lots of cheaper food offerings but St Catherine's does get a bit "rough" later at night. The Meridien itself is well located near the Guy-Concordia metro entrance. Rooms As a SPG Plat, I received a suite during my 1st stay and a regular room on my 2nd stay. To be fair to the hotel, they had upgraded me to a suite on my 2nd stay but it wasn't ready. I decided not to wait for it and took the regular room instead. As others have mentioned, the rooms are showing its age. Yes, they probably are in need of renovations. Yes, there were spots where I could see the wallpaper peeling away. However, it's also worth mentioning that this is the most value-priced Starwood hotel in Montreal. Given the inevitable raise in pricing after a renovation, I'd choose to leave it as it is. Also, given the area, I'm not sure a higher priced hotel could be supported. For the suite, it was really just a large room. There wasn't any separation with the "living room" as there were just sofas added to the end of the bed. My HVAC wasn't working when I arrived so I had to call down to the front desk to have someone come up and turn it on. I thought this was poor planning as they knew I was coming in. There was also a small "kitchen sink" area beside the bathroom - probably because the bathroom sink is really small. The bathtub was actually a jacuzzi with a makeshift shower curtain around it. Water pressure was decent although earlier claims of hard water build-up was evident. For my regular room, there was a separate area between the entrance and the bedroom where the fridge, safe, and hangers were located. Other than that, I thought it wasn't too much different from the suite, except for the size. Restaurant As a SPG Plat, continental breakfast is included. 5 years ago, the buffet had a hot option where I could be upcharged. Now, there are no hot items so it's not even an option. A bit disappointing but otherwise indicative of the economic downtown. Service This is where I think the hotel really shines. The front desk folks were extremely helpful and did their best to answer my offbeat questions. The wait staff in the restaurant were also exceptional. Final thoughts Would I come back? Yes. Would I recommend a colleague? Yes, but I'd warn him beforehand. Tips The area is loaded with ethnic restos but I found it extremely difficult to find healthy food. The one place I finally came across was Dubai Stu's. They sell local subs but they also sell frozen yogurt with all the fresh fruit (or candy) toppings you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: c2coke
Reviews.Content: For a boutique hotel, this is as good as it gets. all staffs are friendly. the hotel is well-maintained, clean, room is spacious. i've stayed in quite a few starwood properties in major north american cities, the room i stayed in at le meridien is comparable to many sheraton even westin locations. the room had a lot of small touches to demonstrate what le meridien sets up to be in the starwood family.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: TravelfiendNJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not new but it is well-maintained. The staff is extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgable. Our room was comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate. We were able to walk to most places, but we love to explore cities on foot. The hotel is close to shopping and universities but in a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to serve”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel and is in a good location to shop and dine. The staff are very helpful and friendly especially in the bar. We had a problem with our TV and even though it was later in the evening they were able to at least get a picture. We booked an executive queen room which had a great view but was very very small. The bathroom has barely room for one person. The decor in the room was well done and the bed linens are super. The breakfast (included in the executive rooms) was Ok nothing special but adequade. It was nice to have free WIFI although we did have to contact the help line/desk to get it up and running.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience for Le Meridien”
Reviews.Author: Caymus59
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation to Montreal. We chose Le Meridien more for the reputation of the brand and less for the location. The hotel experience was disappointing but we really liked the location. The hotel is small, more like a boutique hotel which would have been great had the service measured up. Our first room smelled horribly of cigarette smoke despite being a nonsmoking hotel. Te staff seemed to be completely unaware and shocked. Worse yet, the housekeeping staff failed to clean our room on our first full day after returning at 3pm. The maid did not want to do it after were to leave for a concert at 5 pm. She felt that after we called, it was an inconveience!! The rooms were comfortable but the AC was very loud at night an woke us both up every time it turned on. The hotel has very limited amenities - small lobby, no services other than a small restaurant. The hotel did have a comp passes to nearby museums which was quite nice. The location on Sherbrooke put us close to shopping on St Catherine and the museums/restaurants, but a bit of a cab ride ($15 each way) to Vieux Port. We preferred the Sherbrooke neighborhood to the big corporate hotels (Intercontinental, Westin, W) near the port. We loved Montreal in the summer and will definitiely be returning. Will likely search for a different hotel despite my loyalty to SPG.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BobV_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meridien Versailles for three nights on our Canadian vacation. Staff was great & very friendly. Room was very clean, had adequate size & looked like it had been recently renovated. Only negative-- carpet looked worn & tired. The location, only a couple of blocks from the metro station made everything we wanted to see a very quick journey. Not far from the university so there is a youthful feel to the neighborhood & some nice inexpensive pubs nearby. Very unusual funky elevators. I will have no problem booking this hotel on our next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding choice for area!”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: One of two hotels I have tried at this particular rotation (the other was Chateau Versailles) and by far better than the other in most respect: Great location, so will not emphasize. Rooms: spacious, comfortable, great beds, large windows, good climatization, turn down service, high quality of internet connection. Other offerings: gym ok, restaurant good (but expensive), friendly and helpful hotel staff. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: teri_miss
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet hotel. Close to Metro station Guy-Concordia, shopping on rue St-Catherine, and the Montreal Museum of Fine Art. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The price was right too -- $121 Cdn per night for weekend. Only one complaint: I booked a room with 2 double beds as I was travelling with my teenage niece. I was upgraded to an executive king suite with a sofa bed. I accepted it, but in retrospect I wish I had insisted on the 2 doubles as using the sofa bed required a fair amount of furniture rearranging.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, however dated hotel in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: MF_Bry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first time. First of all be prepared for a bit of a walk to downtown area and a $15 taxi ride to the village. The hotel was a bit too far from the center for me, but I should have looked at the map closer before booking. The hotel itself has an appearance of a boutique property. There is a lot of interesting art on the walls, the rest of the decor and the ambience creates a pretty unique atmosphere. However, the boutique hotel could have personalized attention as additional touch to guests, it would add it some personality. My room was clean and comfortable. But I was in a suite, maybe other rooms are smaller. Even my suite was kinda small for a suite. Oh well. The view was non-existent from my room. My biggest complaint is the bathroom. Not enough light, the shower is worse than what I saw in holiday inn express. The bathtub was dangerous to get out of. Really need to start your renovation project from that bathroom! The amenities like coffee pot and the fridge looked cheap. Definitely did not look like a luxury hotel to me. Average.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: SoloSpaGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, so that is very important. Beds were small (but that might be common for older hotels, or hotels in Montreal). The staff was super friendly. Our air conditioner was broken but as soon as we told the front desk it was fixed immediately. Try to request a room away from the elevator because you will hear it go up and down all night, it sounds similar to a train or a thunderstorm. I personally would not stay here again because it was not my style. i am more of a "W HOTEL" guest. So, if this hotel style is to your liking I would recommend you give it try.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and in nice location”
Reviews.Author: conciergeinnewyork
Reviews.Content: The hotel feels small but because of the Starwood ownership, the amenities were all nice and the rooms are clean and spacious. The neighborhood is somewhat residential and well located. Nice, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-situated spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: Canadalalala
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for the night en route to Quebec. The rooms were a good size, and the washroom had a nice, deep bathtub. The beds were disappointing, as they were much firmer than any I would expect in a hotel. Wifi internet was spotty and I lost my connection several times. Parking at the hotel was $26, but parking at the university was $15 if you are willing to park two blocks west of the hotel. Overall, this hotel was a suitable place for all of our needs while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great people, beautifully decorated rooms”
Reviews.Author: debaer111
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Meridien Versailles. I really don't understand what anyone has to complain about this place. The roll away bed for my 4 year old was fantastic. I loved the walk in closet and the sitting area -- what a bonus in a standard room. The elevator music was so pleasant -- sometimes lyrical, sometimes new age. The staff was perfectly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for rooms the size of a bathroom and paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: kisstanza
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled with another couple and we had 2 separate rooms. The main entrance looks very elegant. This is by far a false representation for the rest of the hotel. The elevators fit 4 people max- very snug. The rooms are very small. They are the size of my bathroom. Door knobs on the closets are missing. The amount of money they charge for a small-bathroom-turned-into-a-bedroom is ridiculous. If you are looking for luxury - this is not the place. We have stayed at a 3 star hotel with better presentation and for less money. This a 3 star hotel charging 4 star price - My impression was that they spent so much money modelling the main entrance, they forgot about the actual rooms. We also received a noise complaint but not until the following morning. The next night we were aware that the walls were thin, so we kept it to a low whispering. Even then we received a noise complaint, saying we were heard talking loudly. The walls are very thin. Management is not very professional or courteous and lacks manners. More training with customer complaints could be beneficial. The best thing about this hotel is the house keeping department. Rooms were clean and everything neat. (Except for a forgotten already- filled out survey left from the previous people - which had also said the rooms were small). I had forgotten some items at the hotel, and housekeeping were kind enough to set it aside for a couple of weeks. The lady in house keeping was more professional and friendly than front desk staff. They should get a raise just for knowing how to speak with customers. Overall, I would not go back to this hotel and I would not recommend going with other couples or friends because socializing would not even be an option. And if you're going solo or just with another person - you can hear your neighbours through the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a boutique hotel but even better!”
Reviews.Author: Patriciaychou
Reviews.Content: Located in the upscale "Golden Square Mile" area of Montreal, Le Meridien Versailles is an ideal place to stay. It's conveniently located in walking distance to museums, the shopping district on Rue St. Catherine, abundance of restaurant choices along the art district, and it's also easily accessible via public transport to other touristy parts of Montreal with major bus stops at the front steps & the nearest metro station just a block away. But it was the first class personal service that made me feel extremely welcome during my 1-1/2 week stay at their hotel. Each morning I was greeted by their friendly staff who are always eager to help. John at the front desk allowed me to check in 3 hours prior to my reservation and another staff (I think his name is Stephen with a dark beard) provided a late check-out til 2 pm on the date of our departure, as well as, luggage storage as we went out for dinner on our last night in downtown. The hotel itself is on a smaller scale with limited facilities (no pool but a small gym/sauna and business lounge plus a separate restaurant that does not provide room service.) However, when we felt like dining in our room, the front desk staff again came to our rescue by making recommendations on places that deliver. (TIP: Call Angelo's for Italian food, they had a huge selection with very good service.) The room size is adequate although the bathroom is a bit tiny. I would recommend that the hotel invest on upgrading the bathroom fixtures in the near future. Housekeeping worked around the clock so that we were not disturbed when we wanted to sleep in on the weekends. My kids get a kick out of the funky "glowing" elevator with nature music. I would definitely be returning back for another visit soon. Thank you to all the great staff at Le Meridien!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of a reno...”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelto_11
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, at the west side of Montreal, so a bit out of the core, but handy still to many attractions. The hotel is in need of a renovation though. I paid an upgrade for a "Junior suite". While the room is bigger, it is in need of some upkeep and a thorough cleaning. There were dings on almost all of the furniture, more than I would expect from normal wear and tear, and certainly not what i would expect in a 4 star property. The furniture is dated. There is no "Sweet Sleeper" bed, or whatever the Meridien equivalent is. The shower head and shower fixtures are old. They advertise a spa tub, and while yes, the tub with the jets persists, there are no controls to turn it on! Likely the motor has died! Just OK...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Superior Location”
Reviews.Author: CdnSingle
Reviews.Content: Montreal is wonderful even if in perpetual road construction. The staff at this hotel were complelety attentive and friendly. The car valet service is worth the money and the service is very prompt. The staff display a Quebecois charm, I tried speaking French only to be politely answered in English (they can tell). The room is not huge but adequate and clean, the location is downtown close to but not too close to the party streets. A very upscale Paris feel about the place with the funky cool aqua elevator. If you are one to fuss over minor details this hotel is not for you. If you want a nice hotel with Quebecois charm and superior staff, check it out. I will use this hotel as a base for future Montreal mini trips.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel .....”
Reviews.Author: pzshaw
Reviews.Content: It is the hotel that we always return to when we travel to Montreal. I have read other reviews and am very surprised at the negative ones. We always upgrade to a junior suite and love the space and the view of the mountain. I would happily redecorate and spruce up a bit but value for $ it is well worth it. Members of the staff are amazing = courteous, friendly, helpful...I am from Montreal so I don't need directions or recommendations but I have heard the staff with other guests and they are great, The location is perfect if you love Sherbrooke Street, walking, art galleries and ambiance (note there is a Joe Fafard sitting on the sidewalk just steps from the hotel!!!! ) I have travelled extensively, as has my husband, and we have stayed in marvellous hotels around the world. This is not a "grand" hotel but its qualities are very fine and offer guests all that is required for a visit to a great and beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “little out of the way to downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: RoadLessTravelled74
Reviews.Content: i've stayed here twice, both times for sports-related venues near the Complex Aquatique. located in a lovely area of town; prices are reasonable and near the metro. i didn't interact too much with this staff except for check-in and for the valet service for a cost (metered street parking). only complaint: the elevator was on the slow side and that the ice vending machine didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “One of The BEST Hotels In Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: rcdlp
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 friends stayed at this hotel this past weekend - I'm the type of person to really research hotels and find out the most that I can and this hotel was just fantastic. I've read probably all the reviews written in this trip advisor site and I'd have to say that this hotel was amazing. Mind you, we stayed in a Executive Junior Suite but from the Valet Service to the front desk to the beds and the view - I had absolutely no regrets with this hotel. The Location was also amazing- we were within walking distance of museums, malls, clubs and restaurants. The bed especially was so comfortable! I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful staff, fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TomCTTrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and it was a wonderful experience. The room was clean and well-appointed with many extras such as in-room coffee service, comfortable chairs, and a very comfortable bed. The elevators are so cool--interesting decor and sounds created by artists, definitely a nice touch. The checkin process was quick and efficient, the valet service was superb. The checkout process also was good, I believe the agent's name was John, and he helped us verify our information and made sure everything was done to our satisfaction. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and appointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: cagelis
Reviews.Content: I am shocked that this hotel is part of the Starwoods Hotel Collection. I have stayed at many Starwoods hotels and have been very happy. This was not a very good experience. The room was very small and outdated. The rug was old and filthy. We had a problem with the air conditioning twice and it had to be defrosted before it was working efficiently. This was a very big inconvenience. If it wasn't for the wonderful helpful staff I think we would have had to find another hotel for our stay. I do have to say that the staff was great. They had wonderful recommendations for dinner and mapped out everywhere we wanted to go. They brought us complimentary waters and chocolates at night. If they updated and cleaned up the rooms it would be a fabulous place to stay. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sheg
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights (Priceline) at this wonderful hotel and if we didn't have to change our plans would have been there for the third. Decided to upgrade to an executive queen since it was my birthday. The room was a great size, loved the wall of windows, and the dark grey was actually very cool. Bathroom was a touch small but the tub was a great size for a bubble bath! The bed was GREAT! Gym was very limited but it worked for me. Parking is valet and expensive.....it's a city! That's the way it goes. The valet staff was very nice and prompt and efficient. Never used the restaurant although the menu looked nice. If I had to complain about something, the elevator seemed to make too much noise which we could hear in our room when it was running. Fortunately it was quiet in the late evening! Loved Le Meridien and would recommend. We were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgatable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaideepk
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived at the hotel I felt welcomed, the staff was very friendly, helpful and caring. I was upgraded to a Junior sweet and received free breakfast!, The room was large and had very nice interior.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lollersby
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until the moment we departed every single member of the staff was punctiliously courteous, friendly, and helpful. The room was great, and had a large walk-in closet. Street noise was bad during the day due to heavy construction (jackhammers) but not at all noticeable at night. The elevators were a unique highlight of the stay - why can't all elevators be such a relaxing mood-lit zen experience? The breakfast bar was good, if expensive, and the restaurant staff continued the excellent service we experienced in the rest of the hotel. Very conveniently located on a quiet section of Rue Sherbrooke. Walking distance to the Musee des Beaux Artes (4 blocks), Crescent Street restaurants (5 blocks), and shopping and eateries on Rue Ste. Catherine (3 blocks). Bus and metro stops within a block made getting to other locations around town very easy.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOSPITALITY OF ENTIRE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: dgaribaldidpm
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION & OUTSTANDING STAFF! I would definitely return to this hotel & I would highly recommend it for both business & leisure. Excellent location for McGill Univ. Museum of Fine Arts, and St Catherine St. The rooms are tastefully done, and the beds very comfortable. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “First time in montreal”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveler22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the le meridien for my first stay in Montreal. The rooms were a good size and had all the amenities I needed. Exertions I stepped out housekeeping was ready to clean the room, the concierge and front desk staff were very helpful and knowledgeable and the location was perfect. I can't wait to go back to Montreal in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: schnugchi
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our short one night stay. The bed linens were plush and the decor was modern and tasteful. The hotel itself is a smaller boutique style hotel with an artsy focus; fitting for the location of the hotel which is surrounded by galleries, restaurants and carefully curated shops. Early spring is a good time to travel and our hotel far exceeded our expectations for the price we paid. Would not hesitate to return when in Montreal again. Just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb!”
Reviews.Author: MaryBeth24
Reviews.Content: Le Meridien Versailles is an intimate, boutique style hotel. We have traveled to Montreal many times and the location of this establishment is almost ideal. It is a very short walk to the hustle and bustle of St. Catherine's Street and Crescent Street. The staff at Le Meridien Versailles were equally pleasant and welcoming. Restaurant suggestions were both appreciated and enjoyed! Our room was lovely and we never heard any noise while there. It was a short walk on Sherbrooke to a reasonable parking lot with in and out privileges. For a very pleasant stay in this lovely cosmopolitan city - we strongly recommend Le Meridien Versailles!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, spacious, clean.”
Reviews.Author: annieurban
Reviews.Content: Visited Montreal for two days with my 18 year old son, who'd been admitted to McGill. Pleasant walking distance to campus. Lovely hotel: not too big, not too small. Very reasonable rate for spacious room. Nice bedding, comfortable room, newish marble bath, whole place very clean. Quiet for a city location. Front desk clerks always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean European-style hotel in a pleasant area.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean, modern, well-equipped rooms with 32" flat LG plasmas with 40+ channels (no HD), a large work area, office chair, comfortable sofa chair, CD alarm clock and a safe. Size of room is smaller than a typical urban 3.5-star offering, but still very functional. Comfortable bed and pillows. Heat worked well and the unit was very quiet. Instant hot water and very good shower pressure. Thick towels are in good shape. Bathroom was above-average in size and offered a great deal of counter space. Nice soundproofing of windows; on the 9th floor, I could not hear anything from outside. Nestled in a trendy part of town, with many charming art galleries, restaurants and shops nearby. Two convenience stores within a block, and two short blocks from the Guy-Concordia Metro subway (just go south on Saint Mathieu). About a 15-minute walk to the VIA central train station. Hotel incorporates the vibrant touches more commonly seen in upscale European hotels, with imaginative and soft lighting, narrow hallways, intriguing artwork, therapeutic elevators and deep bathtubs. Efficient check-in and check-out, all staff were professional and courteous. While I didn't try the RIDI bar/restaurant on this stay, the in-room menu is very appealing, with most entrees around $20. Cons: Very little to complain about. The toilet in room 958 is a bit loose and needs to be tightened to the floor. For a 3.5-star property, an in-room mini-fridge would have been greatly appreciated. I couldn't find any documentation for the location of ice machines, prompting a hunt for one. While I did not drive, the parking situation would be rather difficult with ongoing construction nearby. I would avoid driving here altogether, it's a wonderful part of town to explore on foot. Overall, a very pleasant stay. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, attentive desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Gator_Traveler42
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights on a business trip. The desk staff was helpful and curteous. My room was spacious, with a small sofa and coffee table. The hotel is nice and quiet and the noise from the street below did not reach my room (on the 11th floor). The location is great, within walking distance of many restaurants, cafes, and convenience stores. The lobby and elevators are small but funky. I'll be happy to stay at Le Meridien again.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive service, good location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JBR001
Reviews.Content: I am a regular customer and Starwaood Preferred Guest members. I am frequently offered upgrades to corner rooms featuring a sitting area and panoramic views. The service is attentive and this property is well located, close to shopping and restaurants, yet in a quiet, upscale area. This hotel is a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Expected too much from the room description...”
Reviews.Author: FreddyFuFu
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Gold preferred guest, I had access to rent a superior room with a jacuzzi bath and marble bathroom at a low rate. We decided to give it a try to celebrate St-Valentine's day during the weekend instead of monday night. The exterior of the hotel is not too impressive. The interior is less impressive. I felt cramped in the small elevators and narrow corridors. It smelled like old carpet and the color scheme is depressing. The room was big and confortable but the marble bathroom was a deception... a bit small and no space for 2 in the jacuzzi. The week before, we had stayed at superior room in the Four Points by Sheraton of Levis and it had a magnificent marble bathroom with a sliding wall that allowed to watch TV in the room while taking a relaxing bath. I guess we imagine something similar. The bath worked fine and was relaxing, but we could not enjoy it as a couple. The front desk seems a little confused about Starwood promos and practices but was very friendly and polite. I had prepaid and reserved the jacuzzi room but pretended that they had already gave me an upgrade and could not come up with my original reservation to prove his claims. I was in a hurry to go to the restaurant so I let it slide. Overall, it was ok but there are better options not far from there... like the Sheraton center.

Reviews.Title: “HARDLY LEISURE BUT...”
Reviews.Author: rosbot
Reviews.Content: We were in Montreal to attend to the affairs of my recently deceased relative. Our days were stressful and tiring. So we were very appreciative of the very quiet, dark and comfortable room each night. The proximity of the subway was very convenient. We stayed ten days and would return to this hotel anytime we are in Montreal again!

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: ultimateplayer_09
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend to shop and relax. As I checked in, I asked where I could park. The clerk said there was no parking, that I could park on the street for free overnight in 10 minutes or I could pay 26$/night for valet parking. The problem is Sherbrooke O is under construction and it was a hockey night. It took us 20 minutes to park and we had to walk for 10 minutes with all of our luggage after a big day of shoppin. I took for granted parking was included when I called, the clerk said I should have asked when I made the reservation! Although I wasn't happy with the parking situation, the staff was courteous. Our room was clean but the beds need new matresses, they sank in the middle. For the price I paid I was expecting more comfortable beds and better parking. Ridi Restaurant, (high end) was delicious and the service was attentive, professional... wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Gem of a Reno!”
Reviews.Author: paulela
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. Stayed on the 10th floor with a view of the mountain and overlooking Sherbrooke St. The deco of the recently reno'ed rm was modern, tasteful, classy, cozy and welcoming. It was perhaps one of the smallest hotel rm Ive stayed in but the decor was so well done it made the small size irrelevent because it translated into an intimate environment. Thus hotel is close to a number of attractions (look up google maps) and is a 5min cab ride to the business core (St-Carherine St. + McGill College Ave. area). Would love to stay at this hotel again. One of the nice touches us the friendly greetings from the doorman and frontdesk staff... makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Livingstyle
Reviews.Content: I was recently traveling with my daughter for a shopping weekend. We booked all our travel on points and had purchased travel vouchers for the hotel. We had lots of trouble with the booking (which had to be done through the cooperate site) Upon calling the hotel direct the person on the phone made all the adjustments necessary for our stay. Imagine corporate had me move rooms each night...........not going to happen.I was able to also get a an upgrade for all three nights. I would definitely stay here again .Also as a foot note there is the best French Bakery " Premiere Moisson" unreal croissants and olive bread to die for.Very friendly staff great for coffee au lait. Also the area is full of great restaurants and art galleries and the museum of art, as well as Holt Renfrew all with in walking distance , can life be any better.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel for the price of 4”
Reviews.Author: Plasmatico
Reviews.Content: This was a huge disappointment, not that I like Le Meridian hotels in general, but was certainly expecting more. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, if you are traveling to Montreal on vacation (leisure), your best bet is to stay in Old Quebec. The only reason we stayed there was because AMEX Travel Services mentioned they had a sale, big mistake. This is not like the other Asian inspired Le Meridien hotels, this is an old, outdated property and the staff was kind of clueless to the mention of even well known restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesPharm
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the hotel on-route from Halifax to Toronto. The staff were courteous and even directed us to free parking. We received a jr suite which was quite spacious and had a jacuzzi tub. The bed was one area which could be improved - it was not the most comfortable bed I have slept in recently at a hotel and the rails were sticking out, which I hit my foot on. The hotel was interesting in that the elevators sounded like being in the forest or by a river, with neat lighting. This hotel allowed my dog at a minimal charge. I plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, great service and great price”
Reviews.Author: robikor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LM V while attending a conference. The conference was at the Fairmont but being the Starwood junkie I am, I chose LM as the price was the same as the group rate at the Fairmont and I like to try new things. it was also $60 less/night than the nearby Sheraton. This hotel is great for people who have stayed in smaller hotels in Europe and like the old world aspect and the personality that is not chain cookie cutter. The lobby is not grand (but who spends time there esp when traveling on business.). The staff was extremely friendly (which is not true everywhere in Montreal) and accommodating,... when I arrived back from the day around 11 PM and asked how long it would take to get to the airport, i got an offer to book a cab - usually you get the reply and staff do not think to ask the obvious question of whether you need help getting there. The room was very nice--- I did get a corner jr suite which had windows on two sides, a very nice, large bathroom and a small kitchenette area with mini-fridge and bar sink. I also thought the pricing on the amenities (mini-bar, room service) were very reasonable for a hotel; $2.75 for a soda, $3 for a candy bar or pretzels, and the room service breakfasts were around $12-15. All in all, a fine experience for the price of C$161.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recemmend this hotel. Pictures available.”
Reviews.Author: fostermom
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week for 2 days as a getaway with my husband. It was very small and not well kept. I took pictures. Our faucet was loose, our wall socket in the bathroom moved almost an inch and the items plugged in kept turning off. There was a broken light still in the light socket, the grate on the heating was broken and the glasses were dirty. There was no stopper in the the tub(to have a bath) and there was a nasty ring around the bottom of the toilet. Someone had had a piece of fruit and stuck the sticker on the counter and it had not been removed before our stay. The paint was chipping and one of the chairs had an unidentifiable stain on it. I have pictures and video if you are interested. Email me at ermd@rogers.com

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and over rated”
Reviews.Author: croftScotland
Reviews.Content: Finally found this Hotel (a double doorway!) and was less than thrilled with the price and the Hotel. Compared to the St Paul Hotel on Rue McGill it was two star and the St. Paul was Five.!!

Reviews.Title: “A new experience!”
Reviews.Author: FalcoG
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great rooms, walking distance to major attractions. Great Starbucks coffee at the lobby! Very friendly staff! will return!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: World_Vagabond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Meridian Versailles for two nights and had a pleasant stay. Our bed and the linens were very nice. The bathroom had messy tile detail issues, but the hotel was clean, hip and artsy. Most of all, the staff was extremely professional, efficient, and helpful. The location is close to a metro line, and they are close the museum of architecture - and our key cards got us in for free.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with gorgeous artwork”
Reviews.Author: Touristers
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time, staff was very very corteous and helpful, they have a wonderful restaurant downstairs where our hostess had happened to have just graduated form Art school and had some beautiful original art in displayed...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value make it worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: msmdny
Reviews.Content: We spent a fun labor day weekend in Montreal- the hotel is in a great area- walk to museum of fine arts, St Catherine' Street shopping and tons of great restaurants.Taxi to old montreal and the mountain.We had a corner room (1154) with king bed and pullout couch for kids. Great view, nice furnishings, but a bit tired- seems about 10 yrs old and due for new carpet, etc. but no prohibitive-- room was spacious and service excellent- and great value for size room. I rec Lowes hotel vogue if you want fancy, and Meridien for value

Reviews.Title: “Hip, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: friedman29
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Beaux Arts museum and downtown. Very modern and hip. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jenn1995
Reviews.Content: this hotel lies just near rue saint-catherine, so a convenient location to shop and eat. it's located in a quiet place, for a restful stay. the staff were very friendly and answered all my questions easily, making it no problem to navigate in a city i'd never been in before. there were a ton of restaurants nearby, making it difficult to choose where to eat, which is always a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: burberrygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average, but definitely not up to par for a Le Meridien. I had expected a lot better. The minibar had someone's leftover food in it, so it hadn't been cleaned, and when I asked them to clean it, they made it seem like a big inconvenience. No apologies, nothing. The bathroom wasn't as clean as I would have liked it, but the bed was comfortable, and the bedding was clean. The staff at the front desk was hit and miss. Half of them were nice, and half were just not very service focused. Overall, it was not somewhere I would stay again, and definitely was not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel searching for an identity”
Reviews.Author: travelingfolks080
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very familiar with this hotel, having stayed here at least 10 times over the last 15 years. We have seen it go through different owners, all with a different idea of what it should be. It is a small hotel in a great location. One bellman we have known for over a decade. He remembers our names and warmly greets us when we arrive! The rooms are comfortable, with very comfortable beds, but are alittle worn. There was a hole in one of the sofa arms and the carpet was stained. The hotel has not kept up with its competition, at least its competijtion here in the states. Internet in the room is a stiff extra charge, there is no microwave in the room (you have to pay extra for one), and the fridges are tiny and old. The one in our suite was not working when we arrived and had to be replaced. The worst is the tv. I do believe the equipment is the same as it was 15 years ago, and the choice of channels and movies is pathetic. The hotel has tried to make itself over an an "art" hotel. Whoever did the design for the lobby should be fired. It is pathetic and cheap looking. Also, the elevators now are lighted by "black lights" (remember the 1960s?) and have water sounds piped in. What exactly is this supposed to do? The old elevators were classic, wood paneled and you had enough light to even see the buttons to push. We didn't even bother with the hotel dining room. They used to include breakfast as part of the room rate and it was a terrific buffet. Again, they could learn something from the states where this is the norm. Now the food is overpriced and not very good. We walk two blocks and have a wonderful breakfast and a hot cafe au lait at a Premier Maisson (a great bakery and food chain) for half the price. Again a makeover to make the restaurant look "hip" has flopped. No one goes there and why should they? There is so much better food in Montreal. Overall, the hotel is comfortable with a nice staff, but there is so much more that could be done with this place. Its location at the base of the Mont Royale is fantastic, especially for anyone like us who likes to take a morning walk or run. We would recommend the hotel, but with significant reservations.

Reviews.Title: “I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO PEOPLE WITH ALLERGIES!”
Reviews.Author: Demi12
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel, besause the location of the hotel is very good. Everybody there is very helpful and friendly. However, when we have a hotel it is not all about good customer service and location.... Rooms are dated, we stayed at a room that used to be a smoking room maybe few years ago I am allergic to mould, dust, smells etc... The room wasn't clean in terms of dust on the walls, furniture and floor. The sofa was smelling cigarettes. The carpet definitely needs deep cleaning and not vacuuming only. How do I know that? We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, every morning my nose was bleeding heavily. I was taking allergy medication but it didn't help at all. My kids experienced the same pleasure. For 3 nights there we were all having bloody noses. And this is not everything! When you get out of the mouldy and dusty room your next stop is the elevator that smells some exotic scent....I couldn`t stand it. My eyes were very itchy etc... Same smelly scent situation at the reception on top of a freaky art... The cocktail of smells made me sick for a week now I hope I will get better soon. My point is: every normal company has a policy concerning strong fragrances and specific smells. How come your hotel doesn't have that? I complained at the reception that the smell of that scent bothers me, but nothing had changed after. I assumed that this is the hotel's policy to have it and that is why I decided to not go back in this hotel. We didn't leave the hotel earlier, because it is hard to go around and look for anotehr hotel with young kids. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO PEOPLE WITH ALLERGIES!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: greensubmarine
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in late July 2010. The front desk staff was wonderful, giving us recommendations on where to shop and eat, as well as even helping us with directions for our drive to Connecticut when we left. Our room was on the 10th floor and had fantastic views. The room was on the small side, but completely functional and comfortable. The location couldn't have been better. It was our first trip to Montreal and we were able to easily get to all of the neighborhoods we wanted to visit, and there were a lot of options on terms of restaurants and cafes at all price points close by. (We recommend Boulangerie Moisson on Sherbrooke and M Cafe on Maissoneuve for breakfast.) We parked at the Seminary as recommended by other reviewers (it is the Grand Seminaire du Montreal located on Sherbrooke) and it was $9 per day. Also, the hotel has an arrangement with another hotel (I believe it was called Hotel Maritime, which is several blocks away) so that you can swim if you like. The pool is indoors (a definite plus in winter) and it was comfortable and refreshing. I can't recommend this hotel enough, we had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great â€“ Not Bad â€“ DECENT but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: MandLD
Reviews.Content: Not Great â€“ Not Bad â€“ DECENT but not a 4 star The location is great. This hotel with friendly staff is located within walking distance to one of the main streets in Montreal (St-Catherine, Sherbrooke, Guy, Atwater). However, quality of the room is lacking and not at all what you would expect from a 4 star Starwood hotel at best we would give it a 3 star. Old and smaller room, very small washroom, in need of upgrades, refurbishing, new decor, something to bring it to the level of the other Starwood hotel in town. This hotel is decent, clean and basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: msfirefly007
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance to great attractions such as the Museum of Fine Arts, other fine museums and galleries; St. Catherine's Street for great shopping, great outdoor dining (Crescent Street, Peel Street), and great little restaurants, patisseries and convenience stores. Staff was very friendly and most accommodating; rooms were excellent, and I liked the more intimate size. The restaurant in the hotel is expensive for breakfast, and I would avoid (other great options in the area). For those that desire Tim Hortons and Starbucks, they are also in walking distance, but I recommend supporting the local smaller businesses for their quality offerings. We had an incident with the cab drivers who were fighting over our fare. This is not an unusual situation across the country to see, especially during tougher economic times; however, I use this forum to recommend to the Montreal Chamber of Commerce and the Tourism Montreal bureaus to address such matters with the local taxi companies. It is a disconcerting and upsetting situation to see, and makes tourists feel uncomfortable. I will be back! Thank you Meridien Versailles staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in a great city”
Reviews.Author: JillianTirado
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for my birthday weekend. I was a little scared considering the bad reviews I read. However, I was able to stay there for free using my Starwood pts., and get a suite, so I didn't want to pass on the opportunity. I found the staff to be very helpful. The suite was amazing. We loved it. The room was clean, but not sparkling, like I would've preferred. The grout around the jacuzzi tub was worn, but the went the extra mile cleaning the jets, so much so you could smell the chlorine when you put them on; which i appreciate b/c i'm a bit of a germaphobe. The king bed was comfortable, a little lumpy, but made for a sound sleep. The corner suite was super quiet, and Im a sensitive sleeper, so that was good. My only real complaint, the air conditioning. The unit kept freezing up and would stop cooling the room, thus after a day in the hot afternoon sun, my room would be nearly 80 degrees, instead of the 70 I set it to. The maintinance man did as much as could with his limited resources. The food at the hotel was overpriced, so we did brunch at local places. That being said, the hotel has a good feel; small but comfortable. Chic and stylish. I would recommend this hotel, but DON'T pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: CJIMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the July 4 weekend. The room was clean, and the mattress was comfortable. We also appreciated the cool and quiet A/C - this really helped us to get a good night's sleep. This hotel is on the edge of the downtown area, but it is still only about a block away from the Guy-Concordia metro station. However, on this trip , we had a car. It was not too hard to drive around town - as long as you kept away from the area of the Jazz festival. Thanks to all on Tripadvisor who told us about inexpensive parking near the hotel, at the seminary, about a block and a half west of the hotel, " Les Pretres de Saint-Suplice de Montreal" 2065 rue Sherbrook, Ouest, now up to $9 / day, but still much cheaper than the valet parking at the hotel. You can also sometimes find a parking meter near the hotel. For breakfast ( continental only ) walk a block east to " Le Premiere Moisson " bakery. The croissants were only $1.35 each, and they were just so flakey and buttery... You can get butter and jam ( strawberry - this is Quebec ) with your croissant, if you want. All in all, I found this a much nicer place than the Sheraton Centre Ville where I used to stay, even if the Meridien lacks a pool and a health club. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: susanstoakley
Reviews.Content: The Meridien is a lovely hotel. The rooms are very clean and large (we had the double room). The staff is very courteous and helpful. Beds are extremely comfortable but found the bathroom a bit small but very acceptable. The hotel restaurant is quite expensive and they only have a "buffet" choice for breakfast. The views from the rooms are great (some of the mountain and some of downtown). The hotel is only a short block from the Metro and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. You can get a daily pass for both the Metro and the bus for only $7 per day. Very centrally located and usually the hotel has some "special" deals for visitors. Would recommend this hotel more for adults than families but it would suit both.

Reviews.Title: “Good location horrible customer service and subpar rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: FoxNY1
Reviews.Content: Problems from the start. I was here for a bachelor party which is maybe why we weren't treated well because when the air conditioner didn't work and no windows opened in the room we were told there was nothing they could do and the hotel was completely booked so we couldn't switch rooms. After a restless night we discovered the shower did not drain and it took calling several times for them to get someone to fix it. The room itself is pretty dated buy i will admit the location is good. For the price they charge take your money somewhere where customer service means something.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud buzzing noise in the room”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: It is a nice small boutique hotel with friendly staff. The room was nice and clean with a more cozy decoration than the normal sheraton's. It didn't have an LCD; they should upgrade them. The rate was quite OK ($156 inc. all taxes). The major issue was the very loud buzzing noise in the room. Not nice at all if you want to be quite and reading your book or to sleep. It was only masked if we turned on the TV. I could only sleep because I had my hear plugs. Avoid #1459 if you don't like this kind of continuous loud noises (and it was not the air conditioner, as it was turned off). The elevator had a zen music which was a nice touch! If you don't want to pay around $20 or $25/night to park the car, just go to the Seminar park (just 2 blocks away in the same road), where you can leave your car by $9/night (thank you TA for this tip!). Near from the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to metro. Rooms are...”
Reviews.Author: Marsbar999
Reviews.Content: Good location close to metro. Rooms are clean and have good facilities but are a little on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “weird check-in policies”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok basically, for what it is, namely a slightly off-the-beaten track location on the outskirts of downtown montreal (ie far away from the old part of the city, and far away from the entertainment district, too). Just like the other Starwood hotel (opposite the Le Meridien), the Chateau Versailles, the rooms are small. I was given hassles when I tried to check-in. They insisted on an ID or else I couldn't check in. This is the first time in many many hotel stays where my credit card was insufficient, supposedly because of credit card fraud. It seems the hotel management is unable to call your credit card company and check, in case they're worried. Too much of a hassle for them. So, they'd rather not have you check-in to your pre-paid room (!!!) and see you leave their premises altogether. How farcical is that. The room's interior is distinctly dated (no flat-screen TV, the mattress was sufficiently soft to cause me back pain). I wonder which part of the place is ****...

Reviews.Title: “It has a certain charm - but does need some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: Ratings are often subjective and will depend on what you are looking for. If you are a visitor to Montreal, looking for relatively good value acoomodations without the feel of a big North American hotel, Le Meridien Versailles might register a 4 or 5 rating. If you are a business traveller, it may not have the above-average feel that you are looking for from more business oriented hotels (such as Fairmont Queen Elizabeth, Hilton Bonaventure, Marriott Chateau Champlain for example). One of the best feature of this hotel is its staff. Extremely friendly and helpful. Check-in was processed efficiently and staff even came with me to my room to ensure that my room was prepared as requested. From a feel perspective, Le Meridien Versailles may remind some of a more typical old-style European hotel: small hallways/elevators, somewhat less traditional room layout, furniture / linens that feel a little bit more like home than a cold/modern/contemporary hotel and so on. But like many of these older European properties, le Meridiend Versailles is in need of some upgrades to painting/decor/furniture and so on. Don't get me wrong - everything was in working order so it is not like things are broken. This was a short overnight stay so I did not get to experience breakfats and the other amenities that this hotel offers. Location-wise, it is perfect for friends and families of Concordia University students who may live near the University. The hotel is 2-3 blocks from a Metro station (Guy - Green Line 1) in the west-end of the downtown area. It is not too far from some of the businesses (which are probably located closer to McGill/Sherbrooke), shopping (Ste-Catherine Street), dining and entertainment (Crescent Street) but further away from the main tourist area of Old Montreal Not a bad place to stay if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “My new home in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: thestubesyvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. I really liked the location of the hotel because it is in a low-key but walking distance to the shopping on St Catherines. I also liked that it is a smaller hotel and more personalized service. I found everyone at the hotel to be very friendly and helpful. They have really cool elevators here...mood lighting and sound effects (waves, birds, etc). We also enjoyed the interesting artwork in the lobby. The rooms were nice and the bed was comfortable. I also appreciated the complimentary wireless internet. I travel to Montreal a few times a year for business and this is where I will stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - issue with bed”
Reviews.Author: SksAdvntr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, mostly because I've stayed at the Meridien King Edward hotel in Toronto, which I think is a top notch property. I'd classify the Meridien Versailles as a boutique hotel in the process of renewal. The lobby/common areas are interesting/funky, if somewhat cramped on account of the space being quite small on the ground floor. The artwork partnership they have with an art gallery is pretty cool and I did appreciate the interesting pieces they had on display. Service was excellent and the staff were very friendly. I was lucky enough to get a good sized corner room with a king bed. The room was nicely appointed, overall, although I did have some issues. The biggest issue was the bed, which sagged in the middle and was a bit lumpy. As it was a king bed, I slept well, using a flat portion of the bed, but if my wife had come along, there would have been a definite problem. A medium issue I had was with the sofa set, which was uncomfortable to sit on and worn/dated. A minor issue was that the television was the boxy kind and a bit outdated. The bathroom was OK - and I did use the soaker tub which was a very good size for soaking in. Overall, I would recommend this hotel - very easy to get to and a bit different. I would recommend a bed check upon arrival, as that is a critical item that can make or break a stay. It is well priced for what it is and if I had a comfortable bed, it would have been the perfect stay. They offered free wifi internet with my booking, which was a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: tonyims
Reviews.Content: The Good: The neighborhood is great, close to museum of Arts. close to bars and restaurants. The staff is friendly and helpful The Bad: noisy elevators - get a room away from elevators. airconditioner not working in some rooms. Restaurant was closed and no place to get even a coffee. If you dont expect a luxury hotel, you wont be dissapointed. Think more like a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely underrated hotel that's a terrific value for the price”
Reviews.Author: bettwice2
Reviews.Content: This is such an underrated little hotel. I travel to Montreal often and have stayed at this place at least 10 times. The staff here is always super-friendly, it never seems crowded, the rooms are more than adequate, squeaky clean and nicely appointed (especially the corner mini-suites), and the location is absolutely fantastic--away enough from the hussle of downtown but close enough to walk to everything. Don't listen to the people that say the rooms are too old or in need of renovation; that's garbage. The free internet on the 2nd floor is a nice touch, and one of the best restaurants in Montreal in Bronte is right next door (the tasting menus there are to die for). Moreover, you can usually stay here for $100 a night or so CAD, and rooms are ALWAYS available with cash and points from SPG, which is a huge bonus. They also charge reasonable rates for valet parking. I have a ton of points, could stay at the W, Le Sheraton or Westin if I wanted to, but I would stay at this place every time. I just can't see how anyone could ask for much more for the price. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: jennrose17
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a friendly staff however the rooms are terribly old and in need of major renovation. Location is great however.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: crickerpicker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in late November and it was fine. We especially loved the comfortable bed...no hard mattress like so many hotels seem to have. (I wish other hotels would smarten up and realize people do not sleep on boards any more) Room as clean, we had a nice view of Sherbrooke St. Front desk staff were very helpful as was the valet parking attendant. We got a good rate, too. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mary56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right downtown Montreal. Rooms were clean, we were in 560, no view but who cares, my daughter and I were there for a weekend of shopping. Front staff let us check in early as our room was ready, thank-you Fernanda!! We also parked our car for 7 dollars a day just down the street at the Seminary. Thanks again front desk staff for this bit of information. One thing I need to add, I was having my coffee in the front lobby because my daughter wanted to sleep in a bit, and while there I witnessed a VERY RUDE female American guest treating the front desk staff badly. It was unnecessary, and she was clearly looking for a free breakfast. If these people have such high expectations when they travel, then stay home or go to a 500 dollar a night hotel room. The front desk staff don't need rude customers like you. Anyway, this place is great, and we will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Mar005
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in Le Meridien Versailles. We arrived at check-in time and our room was not yet ready, so they told us they would give us an upgrade to an executive room. When we got there we saw it was quite aged and there was water in the carpet coming from the AC. They sent someone to check it up and he confirmed AC was broken. We were then quickly upgraded to a junior suite due to this. The room was in excellent condition though a bit aged too (I guess other reviews are right when they say the hotel is in need of renovation). Reception was very helpful providing addresses and free entrance tickets to a museum nearby. All the staff in this hotel is very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: prpro70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. That is all I can say that is positive about this hotel. The lobby is modern but dont let that fool you. The rooms are in desperate need of renovation. The last update was sometime in the late 80s and it looks like it -- the rooms show lots of wear and tear. I cant believe the LeMeridien brand would be associated with a hotel property in this unkempt state. I was thoroughly disappointed, especially since I'm a Starwood member. If you have to stay downtown, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: lionelhutz
Reviews.Content: The Le Meridien is a nice hotel in a good location. It's in the northern part of downtown Montreal, but is still within walking distance of the metro, Mont Royal, Museum of Fine Arts, the shopping and food on St Catherine St, and maybe 25 mins from Old Montreal. I booked after finding a great deal. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was upgraded as a SPG to a double/double. It was a nice room, clean and comfortable. While my stay was comfortable, there were downsides. While I was upgraded to a larger room than needed, it was a room that was showing its age. (Looking at some photos here, seems the suites and single queen rooms are nicer.) View was of the next building (brick wall). The room didn't get colder than 73 degrees. After the first night the AC didn't seem to be working so while I was out I had the hotel look at it. When I got back it was off so I started it and it seemed fine. A couple hours later I realized the problem: after running for a couple hours, frost was building up on the vents and blocking the air from coming out. The only way to stop this was to shut the unit off for an hour. I probably should have complained but I wasn't in the room during the day and since the window faced another building/brick wall, I didn't get to much sun anyhow. There is a restaurant, but if you walk to St. Catherine street 2 blocks away you'll find plenty of restaurants. For it's location and the price i found it at, it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: tawhelan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the meridian for four nights at the end of August for a little getaway. I was very impressed with the service from the front desk staff. Anytime I asked them a question they went out of their way to get the information for me. We were always warmly greeted when we returned to the hotel lobby. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. It was within walking distance of shopping and restaurants and the metro was only a block away. I would definitely stay at the meridian again

Reviews.Title: “Le Meridien Postage Stamp”
Reviews.Author: traveler from Hinsdale
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for three nights at this hotel during the Rogers Cup tournament, a major international sporting event. The hotel staff was clueless about the event. When we called to inquire prior to booking about the distance from the hotel to the stadium, we were informed it was 15 minutes on the Metro with one change of lines. In reality it takes about 30-40 minutes and three different lines to get to the Uniprix stadium.
